answers.answer: Years, decades.Your Endo is a diabetes specialist.Go find one that wants your TSH at 1.0 or 1.5 and let them treat you. You are hypothyroid because she is stupid.
yes your levels are to high. you need to get them as close to a 1.0 level. Also you need yoru t4free and t3free ran. Blood work needs to be done every 6 weeks until you are feeling well.

You know, I think she IS a diabetes specialist!  Info on diabetes is all over the exam room walls.Thank you for the advice!  I think my PCM will cooperate with the TSH at 1.5 or better plan.  My referral is up with this endo.  My husband is in the military - health care is MY responsibility to manage, not my doctor's.  Regardless of one's doctor, it is so important to be informed!  I have gotten better care from asking informed questions.  I found out I had Hashimoto's because I asked for the test!I am still wondering, though.  Are ALL these symptoms from Hypothyroid?  I have thrown every doctor for a loop with my keratosis pilaris - they are aggrivated and worse in HEAT.  The cold actually helps my skin feel better.  Has anyone heard of skin issues like this?  I also get hives really easily.

...looked up keratosi pilaris-found it is genetic..so it  passed down thru ur family-since it is genetic...there is no cure, but there are ways to help.....google the name and u will find the info...I had never heard of it.I have been following this thread because I also have hashimoto's and am trying to learn all I can.Good luckGodspeed"selma"

Hi Selma!Thanks!  Yep, it is genetic, but no one in my family has it - although many of my family members have thyroid problems.  In the research I found that KP is related to hormones.  It has the possibility to be linked.  I have no hope of healing - but if it IS linked, then getting my TSH in the ideal range may help.I don't have "text book" KP.  It is worse when I am hot and KP is supposed to be worse in the cold because it is dryer.  I have other skin issues that is related to Hashimoto's - dry itchy skin, susceptibility to hives, etc.  I am oversensitive.  Well, I will find out my answers the hard way - I will get my bloodwork results for this round next week.  I am sure I will be upping my Synthroid dose.  We will see if this helps the symptoms abate or not.How long have you had your diagnosis for Hashi's?

question: In 2004 I had Pero Ab > 70.  I was diagnosed with Hashimoto's and was put on Synthroid.  After getting to 50mcg I felt amazingly better.  I did not know how bad I was feeling.  All was going well until last summer.  I began to get the following symptoms:Inability to regulate my body temperature.  I would stay hot much longer than normal or cold much longer than normal.I got keratosis pilaris and they were perpetually aggrivated and painful (I am told they are usually benign)My skin is dry, but my scalp is oilyI have brain fog - I am forgetting much more frequently and can be at a lose for words.I have fatigue & weight gain.Are these symptoms all from Hashimoto's?My endocrinologist tested the whole thyroid panel and the only remarkable number was pero ab >1000.   She said to increase my dose until my TSH is under 3. (TSH - 4.14)  She also said that there is not much else we can do while my thyroid is sputtering.   When my thyroid dies Synthroid replacement will be sufficient and my symptoms will abate.Have you heard of this?How long does it take a thyroid to die?Thanks!Tutta
